section_summary: Section 11 establishes the continuity properties of the distance-to-companion measurement operator. The section is structured in two main parts: (1) continuity of the expected raw distance vector for k≥2 regime, decomposing error into positional and structural components for stable and unstable walkers, and (2) mean-square continuity of the sampled raw distance vector, proving the operator satisfies the bounded variance axiom and deriving the explicit bound function F_{d,ms}. A critical result is the discontinuous behavior at k=1, where the expected distance vector becomes deterministically zero.
key_results: Bound on single-walker error decomposed into positional, structural, and own-status components
Total error decomposition into stable and unstable walker contributions
Explicit continuity coefficients with singularity at k=1
Verification that distance operator satisfies bounded variance axiom
Mean-square continuity bound function F_{d,ms} for use in standardization operator analysis
mathematical_highlights: Error analysis uses reverse triangle inequality and Jensen's inequality
Double summation analysis for companion selection averaging
Singularity coefficient C_{status,d}^{(2)}(k_1) ~ 1/(k_1-1)^2 reflects fundamental discontinuity
Stochastic variance bounded by N·D_Y^2 uniformly across all states
Deterministic mean error bounded by displacement components
